abstract: What the International Rome Film Festival lacks in star power, it usually makes up for with content and, of course, location.
snippet: What the International Rome Film Festival lacks in star power, it usually makes up for with content and, of course, location.
lead_paragraph: The International Rome Film Festival, which starts Thursday and runs until Nov. 4, may not have the panache of Cannes or Venice. But what it lacks in star power, it usually makes up for with content and, of course, location. This year, Charlotte Rampling will attend for "The Eye of the Storm," a film also starring Geoffrey Rush about a fading beauty planning her own death. Maggie Gyllenhall and Rupert Everett are in town to promote "Hysteria," a film about the history of the vibrator; and Richard Gere will collect an honorary acting award.

headline.main: Euro Zone | Film and Fitness in Rome
